1.title: Curious About ... New York City
1.plot: Explore New York and ask: why are the constellations backwards in Grand Central? Why does the Great Hall at the Met look like the Baths of Caracalla? Why is there a golden Diana statue in the middle of the Metropolitan Museum of Art? Why is Rockefeller Center's Atlas statue permanently grimacing at St. Patrick's Cathedral?

2.title: Curious About ... London
2.plot: Join us in London and ask: why is St. Paul's Cathedral such an iconic symbol? Why do so many London neighborhoods end in -gate? Why is Temple Church round? And what did the secretive Knights Templar do here? And what does all of this have to do with Magna Carta - and why has a copy remained at Salisbury Church for 800 years?

3.title: Curious About ... Wales
3.plot: Why is there a dragon on the Welsh flag? Why does the man next-in-line for the British throne hold the title the "Prince of Wales"? What are the Walls of Constantinople doing here in Wales? Who is King Longshanks? Where is Britain's smallest church? And how the heck do you pronounce the 2nd longest place name in the world: Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch?

4.title: Curious About ... Montreal
4.plot: Why did the French settle here? Why is there a Paris Metro Stop in the middle of the city? Why is Notre-Dame Basillica bathed in blue? Why does the Hotel de Ville look like DC's Eisenhower Building? And is there really an archaeological dig going on under your feet at Place Royal?

5.title: Curious About ... Asheville, North Carolina
5.plot: Why is there a French Loire Valley castle in the middle of the American Deep South? Did you know that the name "Biltmore" is completely made up? Why did the most famous architects put their stamp on this small town? Why did Henry Ford, F. Scott Fitzgerald and Thomas Edison all stay in the same hotel? And how did Scots-Irish immigrants create American country music?

6.title: Curious About ... Victoria, British Columbia
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Curious Paris
1.plot: Why does Paris look like it does? Why were the Eiffel Tower and the Pont Alexandre III built? Why is the Opera Garnier so ornate? Why is there an eastern-style basilica atop the highest point in Paris? Why was a cabaret built inside a red mill (the Moulin Rouge)?

2.title: Curious Rome
2.plot: Why is there a giant hole in the top of the Pantheon? How is it still standing after more than 2000 years? Why does Piazza Navona look like a racetrack? Where did the bronze for St. Peter's Basilica come from, and why are its windows so heavenly?

3.title: Curious Copenhagen
3.plot: Why is Bluetooth technology named after a Danish king? Why did Shakespeare use Kronborg Castle as the setting for Hamlet? Was picturesque Nyhavn really the playground for sailors and brothels? Christiansborg Palace, Amalienborg Palace, Rosenborg Palace - why so many palaces in one small country?

4.title: Curious Vancouver
4.plot: Who was Gassy Jack and why was he so gassy? Why was Capilano Bridge built and what do all those totem poles mean? What's so important about the Hotel Vancouver, and what does it have to do with the train station, the Queen of England, and Harry Potter? Who was Yip Sang, and why did he have his own Boy Scout Troop?

5.title: Curious Loire Valley
5.plot: When and why were so many stunning chateaux built in such a concentrated area in central France? Why is there a river running through Chateau de Chenonceau, and what did the lovely ladies of the castle have to do with it? Why does Chateau de Chambord have 440 rooms, yet no one ever lived there? Why is there a porcupine over the entrance to Chateau d'Amboise?

6.title: Curious Venice
6.plot: Where is the hidden symbol of Venice on the iconic gondola? Why are there two different saints on the gateway columns? Why is the solar system off on Torre dell'Orologio? Why does Saint Mark's Basilica look like Hagia Sophia? Why does the Doge's Palace have a Stairway of Giants, and what do those symbols mean?

7.title: Curious Kotor
7.plot: Why is there a beautiful, tiny blue-domed church floating in Kotorska Bay? Why did someone build 1350 steps up the side of Kotor's mountain? Why is the Cathedral of Saint Tryphon pink? And why are the towers mismatched? Why were the streets within the fortress walls intentionally created in a maze?

8.title: Curious Oslo
8.plot: Why are you encouraged to walk on the rooftop of the Oslo Opera House? Why did Vikings live here, and why are their ships shaped like that? Why was the Oslo National Theatre built, and what's that secret staircase? What is the troll legend, and why did it happen here?

9.title: Curious Bordeaux
9.plot: Who got hitched at Bordeaux Cathedral and why was it such an important moment in history? Did Parisian architecture actually come from Bordeaux? Why is Bordeaux so synonymous with wine? What was the Place de la Bourse hiding? What's with the rooster, the swan and the duck at Place des Quinconces? And what's so gross about the Gross Cloche?

10.title: Sorrento
10.plot: Why did ancient Roman rich and famous choose to vacation here? Why did the Greeks settle here? Who opened the gate for the bad guys in the 1500s? What does the town clock tower symbolize? What's the history of majolica tile art? Why are Sorrento lemons and limoncello so famous? Which saint saved a boy (no, not Pinocchio) from a whale?

11.title: Curious Stockholm
11.plot: What did Alfred Nobel invent that led him to create the Nobel Prize? What is Gamla Stan? What's so important about the silver throne at the Royal Palace of Stockholm? Why did the Swedes grow grass on their rooftops, and what's the history of their folk costumes?

12.title: Curious French Villages
12.plot: Why did the famous French architect Viollet-le-Duc only work on one residence: the historic Roquetaillade Castle? Why is there a monolithic church in St. Emilion? And why did its monk sleep underground? Why is there a giant wall around the tiny village of Blaye? And why was the beautiful Bourg-en-Gironde built into the side of a cliff? What is the King's Fig? And how do Cadillac and Pauillac make time stand still?

locations: New York City, New York, USA
imdb.plot outline: Curious Traveler is a 3-time National Daytime Emmy Nominee, and the nerdy traveler's dream. Remember when you were a child, and you constantly asked: Who? What? Where? Why? and How? Well, this is your enriching and entertaining field trip for grown-ups, who have never quite grown up. Curious Traveler takes you to the most intriguing places in the world, to dig deep into the mysteries of each destination's art, architecture and hidden histories. Emmy Award-Winning travel, arts and culture journalist Christine van Blokland brings her passion and curiosity for history, the arts, quirky characters, storytelling, and lifelong learning to this fascinating series. Each episode begins with a list of Curious Questions: Why are there so many French chateaux in the Loire Valley? Is Rome's Pantheon really an ancient sun dial? Why do Viking ships look different than Venetian gondolas? And why is there a floating church off the coast of Montenegro? Curious Traveler takes you to explore the real story behind your favorite travel destinations. So, come along and learn on Curious Traveler.
